intro: Vataireopsis araroba, commonly known as the Araroba tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The tree produces long, cylindrical pods that contain seeds surrounded by a fibrous pulp. It is often found in humid lowland forests and is valued for its timber and medicinal properties. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
